Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) have been attracting remarkable attention as one of the most promising green energy conversion devices in the recent years.
Titulo: A robust carbon tolerant anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, a high susceptibility of commonly used Ni-based anodes to carbon coking is a major challenge to the successful commercialization of SOFCs.
Titulo: A robust carbon tolerant anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this study, a robust anode with Ni/TiO2-delta nano-network interfaces is reported, for low-cost SOFCs working at intermediate temperatures.
Titulo: A robust carbon tolerant anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This anode demonstrates an acceptable power density, and good stability with humidified (3% H2O) methane.
Titulo: A robust carbon tolerant anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction (XRD) Rietveld refinement, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR), and high resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM) images reveal that the Ni/TiO2-d network-composite anode forms from the in-situ reductive decomposition of NiTiO3.
Titulo: A robust carbon tolerant anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Numerous Ni/TiO2-delta interfaces that facilitate the water adsorption and the water-mediated carbon-removing reactions form during this decomposition process.
Titulo: A robust carbon tolerant anode for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Density functional theory calculations predict that at the Ni/TiO2-delta interfaces, the dissociated OH from H2O (adsorbed on TiO2-delta) reacts with C (locating on Ni) to produce CO and H species, which are then electrochemically oxidized (combined with O2-) to CO2 and H2O at the triple-phase boundaries of the anode.
Titulo: A robust carbon tolerant anode for solid oxide fuel cells
